author: Alex Evans
description:
Corvus Belli, publisher of longstanding Warhammer 40k alternative Infinity, has just shown off a brand new starter box for Warcrow, its new fantasy skirmish game. Titled Song of the Dormant, this two faction starter packs some exceptional looking minis, terrain in the box, and a surprisingly snazzy trailer - and if you join our Discord, not only can you learn about it direct from the creators; you could win a copy too!

Continue reading Warhammer fantasy rival Warcrow unveils new starter set with scrumptious minis
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Warhammer Age of Sigmar armies guide, Age of Sigmar Kharadron Overlords guide,
title: Warhammer fantasy rival Warcrow unveils new starter set with scrumptious minis

author: Mollie Russell
description:
A Dungeons and Dragons book entirely dedicated to dragons will split the fanbase into two camps. First come the dragon lovers, who will be delighted to see an entire adventure anthology about their favorite legendary monster (who is, admittedly, underrepresented in a lot of D&D games). Then there are the fantasy fans who think ‘dungeons with dragons in them’ is a tired concept that’s tough to make fresh again.

Continue reading New DnD anthology Dragon Delves is gorgeous, but misses as often as it hits
MORE FROM WARGAMER: DnD 2024 Player's Handbook review, DnD classes guide, DnD races guide
title: New DnD anthology Dragon Delves is gorgeous, but misses as often as it hits

author: Timothy Linward
description:
When I first started playing hobby board games, it was simple to tell the brain burners from the gateway games - did the game look ugly as sin? Yeah? Probably a brain burner. How times have changed. The recently released Ofrenda has a gorgeous art style that disguises gameplay as tense as defusing a bomb.

Continue reading This charming Day of the Dead board game may look tame, but it's a brain melter
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best board games , Couples' board games, Board games for adults
title: This charming Day of the Dead board game may look tame, but it's a brain melter

author: Timothy Linward
description:
The new Star Wars Legion starter sets will be released in two waves, with the Age of Rebellion armies dropping on September 19, and the Clone Wars armies available on October 17, according to product listings on the Asmodee UK webstore.

Continue reading Star Wars Legion's new starter set release dates revealed!
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best Star Wars board games, Star Wars Legion - release dates roadmap, Star Wars Shatterpoint review
title: Star Wars Legion's new starter set release dates revealed!

author: Mollie Russell
description:
A violent altercation broke out at a California GameStop on July 5 after a man reportedly tried cutting in line to buy Pokémon cards. The Colma Police Department says that it found “one victim with lacerations to the head and multiple stab wounds” outside of the store on 4929 Junipero Serra Boulevard. The attacked man was taken to hospital with “life threatening injuries” but is apparently in stable condition.

Continue reading Man stabbed after someone cuts in line to buy Pokémon cards at GameStop
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best Pokémon cards, Rare Pokémon cards, All Pokémon sets in order
title: Man stabbed after someone cuts in line to buy Pokémon cards at GameStop

author: Timothy Linward
description:
Fist of Suns, an MTG artifact card first printed in 2004, has spiked in price from a stable $4 on June 20, to $18.50 as of Sunday, July 6, according to the Magic market tracker on MTG Goldfish. The price rise started with the reveal of Avatar Aang, a five color commander which - when paired with Fist of Suns - has the potential to cast any card in your deck for free.

Continue reading 21 year old MTG artifact card spikes 360% thanks to upcoming Avatar set
MORE FROM WARGAMER: All MTG sets in order, Upcoming MTG release dates, How to play MTG
title: 21 year old MTG artifact card spikes 360% thanks to upcoming Avatar set
